subject: Re: Fwd: Thanks + Next Steps with Wolf IQ
preview: You're welcome!  We're excited to get the website live. We're standing by for next steps from Chris and let us know how we can helpful.  Thanks, Andy

action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia marked as Closed

full_threads.body:
You're welcome!

We're excited to get the website live. We're standing by for next steps from Chris and let us know how we can helpful.

Thanks,
Andy

Hi Katie, 

Hope all is well.

I’m happy to confirm that the updates have now been completed and are ready for your review.

Here is the link: 
https://hosportal.kinsta.cloud/

If there’s anything else you’d like to tweak or adjust, just let us know. We're always happy to help.

action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia assigned to Rica Rosario Valencia

full_threads.body:
Hey team - can we get these 4 testimonials added below.

Here is the how to:

*Hosportal | Add New Testimonial* - Watch Video

Hi Cindy,

Would it be possible to add these 4 testimonials to the website.
It would be great to have a walk through on how to do this too. I had a
quick look but couldn't work it out.

#1

"Hosportal has dramatically improved the efficiency and accuracy of our
rostering and on-call shift management. The system objectively and fairly
organises the pro rata obligation for 50 anaesthetists whilst accounting
for individual preferences and leave requests. The roster is always live
and viewable and the functionality of the Market and Direct messaging can
facilitate shift swaps and cover at short notice."
James French, Calvary John James


#2

I would like to recommend Hosportal as an exceptionally user-friendly and
intuitive system for maintaining communication within our department. This
platform efficiently handles various functionalities, such as allocations,
rosters, leave management, and messaging, among its many roles. As the
individual in charge of the on-call roster, I am particularly grateful to
the Hosportal team for their outstanding support in establishing a
self-roster system that has significantly simplified my responsibilities.
Despite my struggles with technology at times, I have found the interface
to be accessible and straightforward. The staff have been incredibly
helpful throughout both the design and implementation processes of the new
rostering system, making the transition smooth and effective.
Dr Ann Duffield, Sydney Children’s Hospital

#3
Blacktown and Mount Druitt hospitals have a complicated roster and
allocation set up. We have 3 operating suites to roster with 16 operating
rooms. We also have two on call rosters. We have around 60 consultant
anaesthetists as well as 18 junior anaesthetists to allocate. We have
started using Hosportal last year and it has considerably improved the
accuracy as well as the effort involved in managing all these rosters. We
only have one clerical staff member and trying to work off excel rosters
was a nightmare. There is a steep learning curve for all involved but the
support from Hosportal was excellent and now we have mastered most of the
functionality it has made our rostering and allocations much easier. We are
also finding it more accurate with less errors and it is very convenient to
update the live document via a mobile phone in the OT or clinic or on the
golf course so that the allocations can be immediately updated and kept
accurate. Big shout out to the Hosportal team Shiela and Charles for their
assistance. We would certainly recommend this product as it is able to
manage complex interrelated rostering with a great deal of finesse. The
advanced functionality such as self-rostering and using rewards to fill on
call rosters is remarkable.

Dr Alan Bullingham Acting HOD Blacktown Mount Druitt Hospitals Sydney


#4
I have been working at the Royal Hospital for Women since 2000

Hosportal has always been a very useful program since its introduction.

Over the years they have always keep up to-date with new
resources/improvements to their program;

The anaesthetists are very pleased with the program as it has become now an
essential tool for their work

and communication as we depend more on technology these days.

Royal Women’s Hospital, Sydney



Many thanks,



---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Andy Crebar <andy@wolfiq.com.au>
Date: Tue, Jul 29, 2025 at 11:32 AM
Subject: Re: Thanks + Next Steps with Wolf IQ
To: Chris Jones <chris@hosportal.com>
Cc: Terry Li <terry@hosportal.com>, Katie Funnell <katie@hosportal.com>,
Daphne Bautista <daphne@wolfiq.com.au>


Hi Chris,

Thanks for your note and for jumping in for changes, we'll review this as
part of final QA (and great to hear the walkthroughs helped)

I've put where things stand as of today below.

Thanks again,
Andy


*1. Outstanding items*

1. Would you like us to separate the Contact and Demo pages?
2. Will there be an updated video for the best use page, or should we
keep the current one?
3. We’ve noted the issue you raised with the hamburger menu on mobile
and will review/fix this.

*2. New walkthroughs*

-
*Resizing Sections & Spacing in Breakdance *➡️ Hosportal - Editing spacing
and padding - Watch Video
<https://www.loom.com/share/bd1ae75c632345ab9b676bd8eb2734d8>

<https://www.loom.com/share/bd1ae75c632345ab9b676bd8eb2734d8?utm_medium=gif>
-
*How to check mobile view, tablet view, etc *➡️ Hosportal - mobile and
tablet impact tutorial - Watch Video
<https://www.loom.com/share/100a0981c702458ab125b39e39ed6422>

<https://www.loom.com/share/100a0981c702458ab125b39e39ed6422?utm_medium=gif>


-
*Return Roster Rule Global section (Re-inserting or repositioning global
sections) *

*Hosportal - Global blocks* - Watch Video
<https://www.loom.com/share/72d03cd73d1b4883ba75e346c2528ac5>

<https://www.loom.com/share/72d03cd73d1b4883ba75e346c2528ac5?utm_medium=gif>


*3. Next steps*

- Once the items above are confirmed, we’ll finalize page titles/meta
descriptions and begin full QA (including mobile testing).

These were helpful and I've made a number of changes. I'm starting to
review the mobile responsive view; the hamburger menu doesn't look right;
can you have a look please?

>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> screenshot 1

>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> be seen on over the bar.

>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> a @2x for retina screen, otherwise it looks blur.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Also for the nav bar, suggest to click to show the
